abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Enterprise Development Project (EDP)
            for Gambia. The EDP had four principal objectives: (i)
            enhance the role of the private sector in the economy
            thereby generating employment and nurturing the development
            of Gambian entrepreneurs; (ii) improve the performance of
            the largest bank, the Gambia Commercial and development Bank
            (GCDB), and increase the participation of financial
            intermediaries in the financing of private enterprises;
            (iii) continue the PE reform program; and (iv) develop the
            capacity of banks and Small and Medium-size Enterprises
            (SME) support institutions to prepare, appraise, and
            supervise SME projects, and provide extension services to
            SMEs. Bank performance in project preparation and appraisal
            was unsatisfactory. The important lessons learnt from the
            (i)project are that projects should be well-targeted, with
            clearly stated objectives supported by components and
            relevant activities to achieve them, and (ii)project
            implementation and management arrangements should be
            carefully defined even if a project appears to be relatively
            simple and easy to execute.
